H0.text: Noble gases are copper, silver, and nickel, which are classified as such in the context of the periodic table of elements.

H1.text: Transition metals are the classification for copper, silver, and nickel.

H2.text: Halogens are copper, silver, and nickel.

H3.text: Nonmetals are the classification for copper, silver, and nickel.

A4.text: Copper, silver, and gold are in group 11 of the periodic table.

A5.text: These three metals have one s-orbital electron on top of a filled d-electron shell.

A6.text: Silver does not react with air, even at red heat, and thus was considered by alchemists as a noble metal, along with gold.

A7.text: Silver is a soft, whitish-gray, lustrous transition metal, and it exhibits the highest electrical conductivity, thermal conductivity, and reflectivity of any metal.

A8.text: Nickel is a hard and ductile transition metal.

A9.text: Nickel is one of four elements that are ferromagnetic at or near room temperature; the others are iron, cobalt, and gadolinium.
